intro: Blepharis obtusisepala, commonly known as the broad-leafed beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy, and often blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are broad and oval, and it produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in open woodlands and along rocky outcrops.
